segment.source: Handle app activation
segment.target: Handle app activation

segment.source: Learn how to handle app activation by overriding the OnLaunched method.
segment.target: Learn how to handle app activation by overriding the OnLaunched method.

segment.source: Handle app activation
segment.target: Handle app activation

segment.source: \[ Updated for UWP apps on Windows 10.
segment.target: \[ Updated for UWP apps on Windows 10.

segment.source: For Windows 8.x articles, see the archive \]
segment.target: For Windows 8.x articles, see the archive \]

segment.source: Important APIs
segment.target: Important APIs

segment.source: OnLaunched
segment.target: OnLaunched

segment.source: Learn how to handle app activation by overriding the OnLaunched method..
segment.target: Learn how to handle app activation by overriding the OnLaunched method..

segment.source: Override the launch handler
segment.target: Override the launch handler

segment.source: When an app is activated, for any reason, the system sends the Activated event.
segment.target: When an app is activated, for any reason, the system sends the Activated event.

segment.source: For a list of activation types, see the ActivationKind enumeration.
segment.target: For a list of activation types, see the ActivationKind enumeration.

segment.source: The Windows.UI.Xaml.Application class defines methods you can override to handle the various activation types.
segment.target: The Windows.UI.Xaml.Application class defines methods you can override to handle the various activation types.

segment.source: Several of the activation types have a specific method that you can override.
segment.target: Several of the activation types have a specific method that you can override.

segment.source: For the other activation types, override the OnActivated method.
segment.target: For the other activation types, override the OnActivated method.

segment.source: Define the class for your application.
segment.target: Define the class for your application.

segment.source: Override the OnLaunched method.
segment.target: Override the OnLaunched method.

segment.source: This method is called whenever the user launches the app.
segment.target: This method is called whenever the user launches the app.

segment.source: The LaunchActivatedEventArgs parameter contains the previous state of your app and the activation arguments.
segment.target: The LaunchActivatedEventArgs parameter contains the previous state of your app and the activation arguments.

segment.source: Note For Windows Phone Store apps, this method is called each time the user launches the app from Start tile or app list, even when the app is currently suspended in memory.
segment.target: Note For Windows Phone Store apps, this method is called each time the user launches the app from Start tile or app list, even when the app is currently suspended in memory.

segment.source: On Windows, launching a suspended app from Start tile or app list doesn’t call this method.
segment.target: On Windows, launching a suspended app from Start tile or app list doesn’t call this method.

segment.source: Restore application data if app was suspended then terminated
segment.target: Restore application data if app was suspended then terminated

segment.source: When the user switches to your terminated app, the system sends the Activated event, with Kind set to Launch and PreviousExecutionState set to Terminated or ClosedByUser.
segment.target: When the user switches to your terminated app, the system sends the Activated event, with Kind set to Launch and PreviousExecutionState set to Terminated or ClosedByUser.

segment.source: The app should load its saved application data and refresh its displayed content.
segment.target: The app should load its saved application data and refresh its displayed content.

segment.source: If the value of PreviousExecutionState is NotRunning, the app failed to save its application data successfully and the app should start over as if it were being initially launched.
segment.target: If the value of PreviousExecutionState is NotRunning, the app failed to save its application data successfully and the app should start over as if it were being initially launched.

segment.source: Remarks
segment.target: Remarks

segment.source: Note For Windows Phone Store apps, the Resuming event is always followed by OnLaunched, even when your app is currently suspended and the user re-launches your app from a primary tile or app list.
segment.target: Note For Windows Phone Store apps, the Resuming event is always followed by OnLaunched, even when your app is currently suspended and the user re-launches your app from a primary tile or app list.

segment.source: Apps can skip initialization if there is already content set on the current window.
segment.target: Apps can skip initialization if there is already content set on the current window.

segment.source: You can check the LaunchActivatedEventArgs.TileId property to determine if the app was launched from a primary or a secondary tile and, based on that information, decide whether you should present a fresh or resume app experience.
segment.target: You can check the LaunchActivatedEventArgs.TileId property to determine if the app was launched from a primary or a secondary tile and, based on that information, decide whether you should present a fresh or resume app experience.
